intro: Mallotus glaberrimus, commonly known as the smooth mallot, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with alternate arrangement. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are three-lobed berries that turn from green to red when mature. Mallotus glaberrimus is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, shaded environments.
